summary: Build an app to analyze credit card spending and provide guidance on the correct/optimal way to redeem reward points.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and ensure all user data (transactions, categories, reward profiles) is scoped per authenticated user.
Build a frontend Transactions workflow: manual entry form + editable table, including category selection and search/filter by date range, merchant, category, and card label.

Add CSV import for transactions on the frontend (client-side parsing), with a mapping step to assign columns (date, merchant/description, amount, category if present), then persist imported transactions to the backend.

Implement spending analytics views: totals over time (monthly), category breakdown, and top merchants; include basic insights such as biggest category, month-over-month change, and average monthly spend for the selected range.

Create a Reward Points module that lets a user define reward point balances and redemption options (e.g., statement credit, travel portal, transfer to partners, gift cards) including required fields to compute value (points required, cash value, fees/surcharges, restrictions notes).

Provide redemption guidance and recommendations: rank redemption options by effective value (CPP) and show a plain-English explanation of why an option is recommended, including a warning when an option has low value or hidden costs (fees, surcharges).

Connect spending analytics to reward strategy by allowing users to set category-to-reward assumptions (e.g., 3x points on dining) and show an estimated points-earned summary over the selected date range.
Add an onboarding/help section that explains how to use the app and includes disclaimers that guidance is educational, based on user-entered data, and not financial advice.

Apply a coherent visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) suitable for a personal finance tool, with a distinct style (avoid default template look) and consistent layout for Dashboard, Transactions, and Rewards screens.
Add generated static image assets (logo + simple dashboard illustration) to the frontend and display them in the app shell (logo in header/login) and on the landing/empty-state screens.

Replace the frontend localStorage-based transactions implementation with backend-persisted transactions using the authenticated actor, while keeping the existing Transactions UI/UX (add/edit/delete, filters, table, dialogs) working end-to-end.

new_feature_requests.summary: Credit card spend analyzer (categorize and analyze spending patterns)
Reward points redemption guidance (recommend correct/optimal redemption options)
Create a Transactions data model and CRUD API in the Motoko backend to store credit card spend records per user (date, merchant, amount, currency, category, card label, notes, raw description).

Implement a per-authenticated-user Transactions data model and CRUD API in the Motoko backend to persist credit card spend records (date, merchant, amount, currency, category, card label, notes, raw description) and support bulk insert for CSV imports.

Ensure all spending analytics and reward points estimate calculations use the backend-persisted transactions dataset (not localStorage), so Dashboard analytics reflect the same transactions shown on the Transactions page.

projectName: Credit Card Spend Analyzer + Reward Points Redemption Advisor
